item.title: 2 Aspects of Contact
item.description: 2 Kinds of Contact : resistance impresion labeling impresion

item.title: 2 Aspects of Meditation
item.description: 2 aspects of meditation: Samatha; (serenity, calm, relaxation) Vipassana; (Insight)

item.title: 2 Extreme Practices
item.description: 2 kinds of extreme practices: Devotion to sense pleasures Devotion to self-affliction (from Samyutta Nikaya 12.15, 56.11, Udana 6.

item.title: 2 Extreme Views of Being
item.description: 2 kinds of extreme views in regard to existence: Everything exists Everything does not exist (from Samyutta Nikaya 12.

item.title: 2 Extreme Views of practice
item.description: 2 kinds of extreme views: That the precepts and doctrine are the essence of the training That there is no harm in indulgence in sense pleasures (from Samyutta Nikaya 12.

item.title: 2 Factors for Right View
item.description: 2 factors for the arising of rigth view : appropriate attention the utterance of another. Monks, there are these two conditions for the arising of right view.

item.title: 2 feelings
item.description: 2 kinds of feeling: Bodily feelings Mental feelings (from Samyutta Nikaya 36.22)

item.title: 2 Guardians of the world
item.description: 2 bright qualities that guard the world: Conscience Concern for the results of unskillful actions

item.title: 2 kinds of conduct
item.description: 2 kinds of conduct: To be pursued; unskillful mental qualities decline, and skillful mental qualities increase To not be pursued; unskillful mental qualities increase, and skillful mental qualities decline (from Digha Nikaya 21)

item.title: 2 levels of truths (views)
item.description: 2 levels of truths (views) 1. Conventional truth (mundane, ordinary) 2. Ultimate truth (supramundane, in the language of absolute truth) (from Samyutta Nikaya 12.

item.title: 2 Qualities for Enlogthement
item.description: Monks, I have known two dhammas through experience: discontent with regard to skillful dhammas and unrelenting exertion. Relentlessly I exerted myself, (thinking,) â€˜Gladly would I let the flesh & blood in my body dry up, leaving just the skin, tendons, & bones, but if I have not attained what can be reached through human firmness, human persistence, human striving, there will be no relaxing my persistence.

item.title: 2 Sharings
item.description: 2 kinds of sharing: Sharing of material things Sharing of the Dhamma (from Iti. 98, 100)

item.title: 2 types of nibbana
item.description: 2 types of people with enlightenment / nibbana: 1. The one with fuel remaining (still alive, cognizant of pleasure and pain) 2.

item.title: 2 types of phenomena
item.description: 2 types of phenomena: 1. Mental [mental image] (nama) 2. Physical [label] (rupa) (from Khp. 4)
